title: Why US-Iran tension won’t spoil summer jaunts
text: If you don’t think the oil and gasoline industry has changed dramatically, consider this. Tensions in the Middle East have risen sharply in recent months to a point where the US and Iran are continually threatening each other.

title: IMF Won't Stop China From Turning Pakistan Into The Next Sri Lanka
text: A $6 billion loan approved from the International Monetary Fund this week will ease Pakistan’s debt problems, for now. But it won’t stop China from turning the country into the next Sri Lanka.

title: Crude oil prices fall as global growth fears weigh
text: Crude oil prices fell on Friday, pressured by concerns over the outlook for global economic growth.

title: Asian shares near two-month highs ahead of U.S. payrolls
text: Asian shares hovered near two-month highs on Friday, holding recent gains as investors awaited U.S. employment data, a key release that could make or break market expectations about aggressive policy easing by the Federal Reserve.

title: Asia stocks set to trade lower as investors look ahead to jobs report stateside
text: Stocks in Asia were set to trade lower at the open on Friday ahead of the release of the U.S. jobs report, which could provide clues about future Fed actions.

title: Where Will Bitcoin's Price Go Next?
text: If you are going to play the bitcoin game, have a plan and stick to it.

title: U.S. asks federal court to throw out Huawei lawsuit
text: The U.S. government filed a motion on Wednesday asking for the dismissal of a lawsuit by Chinese telecommunications giant Huawei Technologies Co Ltd that claimed the United States had acted illegally when it blacklisted Huawei's products.

title: How To Average 92% Returns (In 2 Years!) With Safe Bonds
text: President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping have agreed to disagree. For now. Is this a big deal, little deal or no deal for our dividends?

title: Market Hopes: An Easy Fed; End Of Trade Wars. So Far, Neither One Has Happened.
text: The best the agreement between Presidents Trump and Xi did was to temporarily reduce the specter of further growth killing tariffs.

title: Beating the Market With “Wealth Zones”
text: Money, like water, flows along the path of least resistance.

title: Oil prices fall on U.S. inventory data, concerns about demand
text: Oil prices fell in thin trade on Thursday, weighed down by data showing a smaller-than-expected draw on U.S. crude stockpiles and worries about the global economy.

title: While U.S. Closed on 4th of July, the Global Markets Keep On Ticking
text: The 4th of July is one of the biggest holidays in America. Unlike many other major holidays, the United States is really the only nation in the world to celebrate it.

title: Collapsing bond yields push world stocks to new highs
text: Government bonds held near multi-year lows on Thursday on bets the U.S. Federal Reserve would cut interest rates this month and that other major central banks would embrace looser monetary policy, pushing world stocks to new 18-month highs.

title: Making Taiwan Great Again For Investors Amid U.S.-China Trade Tensions
text: The trade war and the possibility of manufacturers shifting their operations from China to Taiwan may spark renewed interest in the island as a tech and investment destination.

title: 'Don't get used to it': OPEC's free pass for US shale will be short-lived, JP Morgan says
text: The U.S. shale industry has expanded at such a rapid rate that it threatens to overwhelm OPEC-led efforts to mitigate demand concerns.

title: Weak Data Could Hasten Rate Cut: Can Banks Cope?
text: Banks, which have emerged creditably from stress tests, are expected to feel the pinch since lower rates weigh on net interest margins.
